creditline: Gift of Charles H. Bell, J. Ford Bell, and Samuel H. Bell
inscription:
Marks; Inscription

On an applied circular plate centered on the reverse of .1 is the inscription: 
 [Presented to JAMES FOR BELL by HIS ASSOCIATES IN GENERAL MILLS INCORPORATED on January 29, 1948 To express their Appreciation of His Highly Successful Leadership as 1915 Vice-President 1925 and then as President of WASHBURN CROSBY COMPANY to the formation of GENERAL MILLS INC. 1928]
markings:
Marks

Each fully marked on underside.
text: James Ford Bell's practice of giving silver to the Institute of Arts did not go unnoticed. In commemoration of his generosity as well as his service to Washburn Crosby (1915-1928) and General Mills (1928-1947), his associates at General Mills presented him with these two lovingly inscribed salvers in 1949. The salvers were later given to the Institute by Bell's three sons.
title: Salver, one of a pair
